class.name: StreamPeerTCP
class.description: TCP stream peer. This object can be used to connect to TCP servers, or also is returned by a TCP server.

method.name: bind
method.description: Opens the TCP socket, and binds it to the specified local address. This method is generally not needed, and only used to force the subsequent call to [method connect_to_host] to use the specified [code]host[/code] and [code]port[/code] as source address. This can be desired in some NAT punchthrough techniques, or when forcing the source network interface.

method.name: connect_to_host
method.description: Connects to the specified [code]host:port[/code] pair. A hostname will be resolved if valid. Returns [constant OK] on success.

method.name: get_connected_host
method.description: Returns the IP of this peer.

method.name: get_connected_port
method.description: Returns the port of this peer.

method.name: get_local_port
method.description: Returns the local port to which this peer is bound.

method.name: get_status
method.description: Returns the status of the connection, see [enum Status].

method.name: is_connected_to_host
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if this peer is currently connected or is connecting to a host, [code]false[/code] otherwise.

method.name: set_no_delay
method.description: If [code]enabled[/code] is [code]true[/code], packets will be sent immediately. If [code]enabled[/code] is [code]false[/code] (the default), packet transfers will be delayed and combined using [url=https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nagle%27s_algorithm]Nagle's algorithm[/url]. [b]Note:[/b] It's recommended to leave this disabled for applications that send large packets or need to transfer a lot of data, as enabling this can decrease the total available bandwidth.
